column4: Hi, I cannot activate my wifi card with my hardware button on my laptop
how can I know what's wrong ?
you should provide details so someone can try to help you. wireless chipset, laptop model, etc
hp pavillon g6, ubuntu 10.04, realtek wireless controller
when I do ifconfig, I don't have any wlan section
well that is a problem... which realtek chip
you can probably check from "lspci | grep -i rtl"
well, I don't have anything else than an ethernet controller
lspci will show it even if it doesn't show up under ifconfig
I have Three entries with lspci | grep Realtek
Network controller, Ethernet controller and something called Class ff00
only thing i get with lspci | grep "RTL" is the ethernet controller
looks like a post I followed to add patches : http://admaris.com/wp/blog/2011/07/03/ubuntu-on-hp-g6-laptop-tales-from-the-grave/
